property.description: Property sheet to hold XML specification for forms

procedure.description: Create a IIS configuration

formalParameter.description: Configuration Name
IP Address of IIS Server.
Port of IIS Server.
Computer name of the server that will run the scripts (e.g. srv01).

procedure.description: Delete an IIS configuration

formalParameter.description: The configuration name that will be deleted

procedure.description: Start an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisreset' is entered, the 'iisreset' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisreset' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisreset.exe'. (Required)

procedure.description: Use XCOPY to deploy Web Site or ASP.NET Application

formalParameter.description: Provide the relative or absolute path to the XCOPY (or similar) executable. (Required)
Provide the path to the source directory. (Required)
Provide the path to the destination directory. This must be a physical directory, but it may have an IIS virtual directory pointing to it. (Required)

Indicate option switches for the XCOPY executable, excluding source and destination directories. The default options are those recommended by Microsoft for ASP.NET and IIS web site deployment; exercise caution when changing these options. - /E: Deep copy including empty dirs. - /K: Copy attributes. - /R: Overwrite read-only files. - /H: Copy hidden and system files. - /I: If the destination does not exist and you are copying more than one file, it is assumed that the destination is a directory. - /Y: Suppress prompting for overwrite confirmation.

procedure.description: Stop an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisreset' is entered, the 'iisreset' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisreset' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisreset.exe'. (Required)

procedure.description: Create and start an in-process web application in the given directory

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the numeric internal identifier of the web site. The default value is 1. (Required)
Specify the path within the web site to the application directory (not the physical path). This path must exist on the IIS server.
Provide the name for the application.

procedure.description: Create a Website into an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. (Required)
Provide the absolute physical path assigned to the web site you want to create. (Required)
Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to create. (Required)
Provide the host header name for the web site.
Indicate if the web site must be started after creation.
Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. i.e: iisweb or 'c:/windows/system32/iisweb.vbs'. (Required)

procedure.description: Create a WebSite into an IIS Server using the ADSI API

formalParameter.description: Provide the server comment for the new web site. In the IIS Manager, this is the Description field under Web Site Identification in a web site property sheet.
Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the absolute physical path assigned to the web site you want to create. (Required)
If checked, this generates a random web site ID. Otherwise, it attempts to create the web site with the user-supplied ID.
Provide the site identification number to attach to the site that you want to create. If no ID is specified, the site is created with a random ID.
Provide the binding string that includes IP and port. Use this format: "IP:Port:". Take of the ":" at the end. (Required)

procedure.description: Delete a Website into an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. (Required)
Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site you want to delete. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisweb' is entered, the 'iisweb' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisweb' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisweb.vbs'. (Required)

procedure.description: Create a Virtual Directory into an IIS Website

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisvdir' is entered, the 'iisvdir' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisvdir' 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisvdir.vbs'. (Required)
Provide the name for the virtual directory. (Required)
Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site for the virtual directory you want to create. (Required)
Provide a path, if necessary, to the virtual directory within the web site.
Provide the absolute physical path assigned to the virtual directory you want to create. i.e: 'c:/Inetpub/wwwroot/myvirtualdir'. (Required)

procedure.description: Delete a Virtual Directory into an IIS Website

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. (Required)
Provide the descriptive name, or the metabase path, of the web site for the virtual directory you want to delete. (Required)
Provide the name for the virtual directory. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisvdir' is entered, the 'iisvdir' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisvdir.vbs'. (Required)

procedure.description: Reset an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisreset' is entered, the 'iisreset' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisreset' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisreset.exe'. (Required)
Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. (Required)

procedure.description: Check the HTTP status of a given URL

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. In this case, only credentials are taken from the configuration if the 'Use Credentials' parameter is checked. (Required)
Indicate if credentials must be used. If checked, the Commander use the user and password typed in the configuration.

procedure.description: Start IIS Services
Stop IIS Services
Fetches the IDs of all Web Sites found on the host server.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself use 'localhost', the default value. (Required)

procedure.description: Returns some basic information about the web site.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself use 'localhost', the default value. (Required)
The WebSiteID parameter must be the numeric internal identifier from the server's MetaBase information. The default value is 1. (Required)

procedure.description: Show the virtual directories (recursively) for a web site.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself use 'localhost', the default value. (Required)
The WebSiteID parameter must be the numeric internal identifier from the server's MetaBase information. The default value is 1. (Required)

procedure.description: Starts the server operation.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the site identification number to attach to the site that you want to start. The default value is 1. (Required)

procedure.description: Continues the server operation after it has been paused.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the site identification number to attach to the site that you want to resume. The default value is 1. (Required)

procedure.description: Pauses the server operation.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself use 'localhost', the default value. (Required)
Provide the site identification number to attach to the site that you want to pause. (Required)

procedure.description: Stops the server operation.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the site identification number to attach to the site that you want to start. The default value is 1. (Required)

procedure.description: Starts an IIS application pool.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the name of the application pool to start. (Required)

procedure.description: Stops an IIS application pool.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the name of the application pool to stop. (Required)

procedure.description: Creates an IIS application pool.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the name of the application pool to create. (Required)

procedure.description: Recycles an application pool. When recycling occurs, the worker process currently serving the application pool will terminate and the WWW service will restart a new worker process to replace it.

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself use 'localhost', the default value. (Required)
Provide the name of the application pool to recycle. (Required)

procedure.description: Use the Windows ADSI container object "Create" method to create a new virtual directory

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)
Provide the numeric internal identifier of the web site. The default value is 1. (Required)
Specify the path within the web site to the application directory (not the physical path).
Provide the virtual directory's identifier. (Required)
Provide the name for the virtual directory. (Required)
Provide the absolute physical path assigned to the virtual directory you want to create. i.e: 'c:/Inetpub/wwwroot/myvirtualdir2'. (Required)
